resources.string: You are about to save this strip to
Select the comic to read the strips
Click on the Comic to Add to My Comics
Getting the list of favorite comics....
ComicReader: Network disconnected, please connect to a network in order to continue reading comics
ComicReader: Network restored, enjoy reading your favorite comics!

No comics selected.

Select comics from Menu -> Select Comics
From now onwards, please visit https://github.com/applications4android/ComicReader/issues and file a new issue to request for a comic to be added
Traverse mode! Swipe left/right anywhere on the image to read next/previous strip. Swipe up/down to move to next/previous comic. Touch here to cancel.
Are you sure you want to clean the comic\'s cache?
Successfully cleaned all the caches of all comics!
Are you sure you want to clean the cache of all the comics?

Network connection broken!

 1. Please check your network connection and then press 'Retry' to clear the cache and try again.

 2. If the problem persists, then only please send us the bug-report and we'll look into it.

Not enough space in SD-Card!

 1. Please press 'OK' to clear the cache and retry.

 2. If this doesn't work then, please press 'Cancel', goto sdcard and manually create space for ComicReader.
Are you sure you want to restore \'My Comics\' list?

If you are facing any issues, look at out FAQs at: http://applications4android.blogspot.in/2012/02/version-2020-faqs.html

For info on how to use this app, refer to the 'Help' page in Menu.

Check 'About Page' in Menu to know what's new in this version.
I would love to help ComicReader!
I am a programmer and I would love to contribute to the ComicReader code-base to keep it alive! Please send me the details to ramp-up on the topic.

ComicReader has come a long way with your continued support. But unfortunately, we are not having enough time to support all your requests and keep ComicReader running! Thus we have the source-code for this app opensourced on github at https://github.com/applications4android/ComicReader! So, we are requesting all programmers out there to contribute to the codebase and help us keep ComicReader alive!
